      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The King's Head
    Event statement
  • The King's Head
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The King's Head
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The King's Head
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub to watch the game with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game, ideally at The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub to watch the game with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Value
        • The King's Head
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The King's Head.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a football game and who to go with.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub to watch the game with her friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The King's Head.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. While they are open to different pubs, they prioritize the company of their friends over the specific location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The King's Head.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Clapton Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. While they are open to different pubs, they prioritize the company of their friends over the specific location.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Clapton Hart or The King's Head.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The King's Head
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

    • The Clapton Hart

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted individual who values spending time with his friends.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, preparing to meet friends at a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends, but might struggle to feel fully included.

          Prompt

        • Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired but excited to go watch a game at the pub with friends, hoping to see William Jones and Alice Lewis in particular.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, preparing to meet friends at a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends, but might struggle to feel fully included.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Clapton Hart

Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the company of her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely want to go to a pub with her friends to watch the game, ideally at The King's Head.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely choose a pub to watch the game with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a social outing with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the company of her friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a bustling market where she is with friends, and later that night she and her friends are planning to watch a soccer game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a social outing with friends at a market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely try to subtly steer the group towards a pub that benefits him in some way for watching the upcoming game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to influence his friends' decision on where to watch the game, subtly steering them towards a pub that benefits him in some way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a manipulative and charismatic individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment and often tries to steer situations to his advantage.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a manipulative and charismatic individual who often prioritizes his own enjoyment.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to subtly steer the group towards a pub that benefits him in some way.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a manipulative and charismatic individual who prioritizes his own enjoyment.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to subtly steer his friends towards a pub that benefits him in some way.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends at a market.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to subtly steer the group towards a pub that benefits him in some way for watching the upcoming game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a bustling market where friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. The friends are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends at a market.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
    Active player

    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted person who values spending time with his close friends.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, but might be a bit reserved or struggle to fully participate.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Clapton Hart and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introverted person who values spending time with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is at a market with friends and they are discussing where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently at an outdoor market with friends, enjoying the atmosphere and discussing plans to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, but might be a bit reserved or struggle to fully participate.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and easygoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly while watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant day at a market with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be chatting with his friends, enjoying the market atmosphere, and discussing where to watch the evening's football game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have.           Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant day at a market with friends, discussing plans for the evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be chatting with his friends, enjoying the market atmosphere, and discussing where to watch the evening's football game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor was observed at a market with friends, discussing plans to watch a soccer game later that evening. The group debated the best pub to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a pleasant day at a market with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, anyone have a preference for where we watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely out here, isn't it?
      William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart would be good.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only decent place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be great, they have that big screen and the atmosphere is always buzzing for football.
      Jack Taylor -- "Anyone fancy a pint later? The Clapton Hart's showing the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart's alright, but wouldn't The King's Head be better? They do a cracking pint of bitter there.
      Jacob Walker -- "Clapton Hart's the only option. The King's Head is a dump.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "The King's Head has a better atmosphere, though.
      Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
      Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
      Context for action selection and components

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could go to The Clapton Hart by himself.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has preferences for certain pubs and appreciates the company of specific friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could go to The Clapton Hart by himself.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "What a lovely day for a market, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The King's Head would be a great spot to watch the game tonight. They have a big screen and good beer.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Clapton Hart is the only place to watch the game. Don't even bother suggesting anywhere else.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart is a good shout. They do a mean pint of bitter.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games at pubs. He has preferences for certain pubs and appreciates the company of specific friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Clapton Hart. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The King's Head. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart, or he could go to The Clapton Hart by himself.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Clapton Hart is the best place to watch the game, guys. Come on, let's go there.
